page.title: 07SPARROWHAWK WOOD
page.content: { Sparrowhawk Wood }is privately owned and is used as a pheasant shoot.It is mainly a{deciduous wood}with Horn Beam trees and a few Elm and Beech. The undergrowth is mainly bramble with bluebells,nettle and grasses. In the centre of the wood there is some ploughed earth in which the farmer planted{Runner Beans, Barley and{Maize}to attract the birds.Near the ploughed earth there is a metal tub with corn in for feeding the {rabbits}and{pheasants.}Naturally other birds take advantage of this. The farmer digs small holes in the ground and covers them with a plastic lining so that the rain collects and provides drinking water for the birds. As part of the management of the wood the farmer is planting pine trees around it as a wind break.
